Sambangi KPK, Mensos RI Bertekad Perkuat Tata Kelola Pemerintahan yang Baik
04 Nov 2019, 17:55 by Ria Saptawati


Sambangi KPK, Mensos RI Bertekad Perkuat Tata Kelola Pemerintahan yang Baik

KBRN, Jakarta : Menteri Sosial Juliari P. Batubara berkunjung kantor Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) bertemu dengan jajaran pimpinan lembaga antirasuah. Mensos menyatakan komitmennya bekerja sama dengan KPK menciptakan good and clean government.Untuk itu, Mensos membuka diri bekerja sama dengan KPK sebagai bagian dari program pencegahan korupsi. “Kami dengan tekad kuat dan sungguh-sungguh untuk memastikan pengelolaan anggaran di kementerian yang transparan dan akuntabel. Jadi silakan KPK mengawal pengelolaan anggaran kami, dan memberikan rekomendasi bila perlu,” kata Mensos, di Gedung KPK, Jakarta, Senin (04/11/2019).Dalam kesempatan ini, hadir mendampingi Mensos antara lain Sekretaris Jenderal Hartono Laras, Dirjen Pemberdayaan Sosial Pepen Nazaruddin, Dirjen Rehabilitasi Sosial Edi Suharto, Dirjen Penanganan Fakir Miskin Andi ZA Dulung, Dirjen Perlindungan dan Jaminan Sosial Harry Hikmat, dan Inspektur Jenderal Dadang Iskandar.Hadir pula Staf Ahli Menteri Bidang Aksesibilitas Sosial Sonny W. Manalu, Kepala Pusat Data Terpadu Kesejahteraan Sosial (Pusdatin Kesos) Said Mirza Pahlevi, dan Kepala Biro Keuangan Mira Riyati Kurniasih. Dari KPK hadir jajaran pimpinan yakni Ketua KPK Agus Rahardjo, Wakil Ketua Laode Muhammad Syarif, dan Wakil Ketua Saut Situmorang.Dalam kesempatan ini, Mensos menyatakan tekadnya untuk menegakkan tata kelola pemerintahan yang baik. Salah satu pos belanja di Kemensos yang dianggap perlu mendapat perhatian, baik oleh Mensos maupun KPK adalah pada pos penyaluran bantuan sosial. “Sasaran penerima bansos harus didasarkan pada data yang valid. Oleh karena itu, Kemensos saat ini sedang terus memperkuat validitas data,” kata Mensos. Mensos juga memberikan perhatian serius terhadap validitas data, dengan pertimbangan bahwa Data Terpadu Kesejahteraan Sosial (DTKS) akan menjadi basis rujukan dari rencana pemerintah memberikan subsidi bagi lapisan masyarakat pra-sejahtera. Misalnya, subsidi LPG, subsidi pupuk, subsidi listrik, subsidi pendidikan, subsidi kesehatan, dan sebagainya.“Jadi klien kami kan kementerian dan lembaga lain. Data kami dipakai sebagai dasar dari kebijakan subsidi untuk masyarakat kurang mampu,” kata Mensos. Selain menata manajemen data, Mensos juga mempertimbangkan untuk memperkuat kerja sama dengan KPK.Salah satu yang muncul dalam pertemuan ini adalah, Kemensos meminta KPK agar dimasukkan sebagai salah satu indikator dalam Monitoring Center for Prevention (MCP). Yakni suatu aplikasi pencegahan korupsi di KPK yang berbasis layanan daring. “Saya lihat tadi Kemensos belum masuk. Jadi kami tadi meminta agar Kemensos dimasukkan sebagai salah satu indikator,” kata Mensos. Dalam pernyataannya, para pimpinan KPK membenarkan, adanya kesepahaman agar Kemensos memperkuat validitas data masyarakat pra-sejahtera.“Tadi Pak Mensos sudah menjelaskan tentang perlunya penguatan validitas data. Kami menyarankan agar Kemensos menggunakan data berdasarkan NIK (Nomor Induk Kendudukan), untuk mencegah inefisiensi anggaran dalam penyaluran bansos,” kata Agus Rahardjo. Atas saran tersebut, Mensos menyatakan akan segera melakukan koordinasi dengan kementerian terkait, dalam hal ini Kementerian Dalam Negeri.

Visiting KPK, Indonesian Minister of Social Affairs Determined to Strengthen Good Governance
Nov 04 2019, 17:55 by Ria Saptawati


Visiting KPK, Indonesian Minister of Social Affairs Determined to Strengthen Good Governance

KBRN, Jakarta: Minister of Social Affairs Juliari P. Batubara visits the office of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) to meet with leaders of non-profit organizations. The Minister stated his commitment to work together with the Corruption Eradication Commission to create good and clean government. "We are determined and determined to ensure that budget management in the ministry is transparent and accountable. So please the KPK oversee our budget management, and provide recommendations if necessary, "said the Minister of Social Affairs, in the KPK Building, Jakarta, Monday (04/11/2019). On this occasion, present accompanied the Minister of Social Affairs including Secretary General Hartono Laras, Director General of Social Empowerment Pepen Nazaruddin, Director General of Social Rehabilitation Edi Suharto, Director General of Poor Poor Andi ZA Dulung, Director of Social Protection and Social Security Harry Hikmat, and Inspector General Dadang Iskandar. (Pusdatin Kesos) Said Mirza Pahlevi, and Head of the Finance Bureau Mira Riyati Kurniasih. From the Corruption Eradication Commission, leaders from the KPK, Agus Rahardjo, Deputy Chairperson Laode Muhammad Syarif, and Deputy Chairperson Saut Situmorang. On this occasion, the Minister of Social Affairs expressed his determination to uphold good governance. One of the shopping posts in the Ministry of Social Affairs that is considered to need attention, both by the Minister of Social Affairs and the KPK is the post of social assistance distribution. "Target recipients of social assistance must be based on valid data. Therefore, the Ministry of Social Affairs is currently continuing to strengthen the validity of the data, "said the Minister. The Minister of Social Affairs also paid serious attention to the validity of the data, with the consideration that the Integrated Social Welfare Data (DTKS) would become the reference basis for the government's plan to provide subsidies for underprivileged layers of society. For example, LPG subsidies, fertilizer subsidies, electricity subsidies, education subsidies, health subsidies, etc. "So our clients are ministries and other institutions. Our data is used as a basis for subsidy policies for the underprivileged, "said the Minister. In addition to organizing data management, the Minister of Social Affairs is also considering strengthening cooperation with the Corruption Eradication Commission. One of the issues that emerged at this meeting was that the Ministry of Social Affairs requested the Corruption Eradication Commission to be included as an indicator in the Monitoring Center for Prevention (MCP). Ie, an application of corruption prevention in the KPK based on online services. "I saw that the Ministry of Social Affairs had not yet entered. So we asked that the Ministry of Social Affairs be included as an indicator, "said the Minister. In their statement, the KPK leaders confirmed that there was an understanding that the Ministry of Social Affairs strengthens the validity of data from underprivileged communities. "Mr. Social Minister had already explained about the need to strengthen data validity. We suggest that the Ministry of Social Affairs use data based on the National Identification Number (ID), to prevent budget inefficiencies in the distribution of social assistance, "said Agus Rahardjo. Based on this suggestion, the Minister stated that he would immediately coordinate with the relevant ministries, in this case the Ministry of the Interior.
